item.description:
Walking Tour of the Amoskeag Millyard
Saturday, May 8, 2010
Starting at the Millyard Museum
10:30 a.m.-12:00 p.m.
$5 Manchester Historic Association members; $10 general public
Pre-registration is required.

This tour provides an overview of the history of the Amoskeag Manufacturing Company and its vast millyard that stretches more than a mile along the Merrimack River. The Amoskeag's textile producing factory complex was the largest in New England. The company existed from 1831 to 1936, and was a great success story of the Industrial Revolution in America.

The company developed the new city of Manchester to support its operations. The walk, led by Aurore Eaton, Executive Director, will explore the heart of the Amoskeag Millyard, and will begin with an orientation in the Millyard Museum.
item.name: Walking Tour of the Amoskeag Millyard
